title: Creativity in Business and in Life, New Maps for the Mind, Approaching Personal Change
description:
Conversation with Daniel Frank, a certified Practitioner of Generative Change.
To learn more or schedule an in-person or online session, you can email Daniela at daniel.m.frank@gmail.com.

We talked about Daniel's background in computer science, operating systems, analyzing and understanding data,  cybernetic models and computational learning.  Daniel also has an MBA in organizational control systems and a background and interest in Music and History of Thought, particularly the great thinkers of the early Christian Church, St. Augustine, St. Anselm, Nicholas of 
Cusa.

Generative change therapy arises out of the teaching of Milton Erickson, Gregory Bateson, John Grinder and Richard Bandler. Grinder and Bandler also established NLP or neurolinguistic programming based on the idea that psychological problems arise from a paucity of language (finding the missing information).

We have incomplete maps of the world.  The map is not the territory.
Antonio Damasio's book, Descartes' Error: Emotion, Reason and the Human Brain looks at the treatment of the mind/body dualism question, positing that rationality requires emotional input.
Rational thought is an overlay on our decision-making process.
Almost all behavior is habitual based on motor programs, but our brain structures are capable of enormous creativity. 
What happens when something in your environment changes and you have to find a new way forward, when you hit a key inflection point of your life?
What was the solution to your problem at one point is now the problem.
How do you tap into the creative mode of cognition and thought?
Generative Change seeks to make a space for that to happen.

https://Karenwongart.com
